concept_data.title: action to establish liability on the part of an administration

summary: The concept of "action to establish liability on the part of an administration" pertains to legal proceedings initiated to determine the accountability of public authorities within the EU framework. This action is grounded in principles of administrative law, allowing individuals or entities to seek redress for damages caused by maladministration or failure to act in accordance with legal obligations. Such actions are essential for upholding the rule of law and ensuring that administrations are held accountable for their decisions and actions. The outcomes can lead to compensation for affected parties and reinforce the integrity of public administration in the EU.
